intro: Centaurea mollis f. maramarosiensis, commonly known as the Maramarosi poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its showy, showy blooms that attract pollinators. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces seeds in a distinctive, spiky structure. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
